text: Taiwan hijacker in custody at south China airport. BEIJING 1997-03-10 A Taiwanese hijacker who forced a Taiwan airliner to southern China on Monday has been taken into custody and is being questioned by airport police, a police official said. "_ The hijacker is being questioned, _"the police official told Reuters. "_ All the passengers are safe. They are at the airport, _"he added. It was not known whether the lone hijacker, a Taiwanese journalist, had surrendered or been subdued by security agents after the plane landed at Xiamen airport. The Boeing 757 operated by the Taiwan airline Far East Air Transport was on a scheduled flight from the island's southern city of Kaohsiung to Taipei when it changed course and headed for the China mainland.
title: CHINA : Taiwan hijacker in custody at south China airport.
